result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin N Peters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence Credit for 55 days granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Metro Drug Unit.  Costs to be paid as a condition of probation after establishing treatment.
Maintain full-time employment and/or school after establishing treatment.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Disclose to any physician your drug history/dependency.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week and obtain sponsor.  Follow through with medical care.

No violent contact with Demi C. or Rachel G.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

timeConds.notes: Non Working hours with standard release conditions - To commence forthwith.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Austin N Peters in court, in custody, with attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1 and 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 3-10 dismissed and read in.  Case 15CM749 dismissed and read in to this matter.

Court orders the following:

Count 1:
- Total sentence: 3 years 6 months (Initial Confinement: 1 year 6 months, Extended Supervision: 2 years) STAYED.  Credit for 55 days if revoked.
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 3 years Probation.
- Cash bail to be refunded to poster 
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Buy money of $2,290.00 to be paid to Metro Drug Unit as a Condition of Probation after establishing treatment
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
- Conditions of Probation:  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Disclose to any physician your drug history/dependency.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week and obtain sponsor.  Follow through with medical care.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school after establishing treatment. No violent contact with Demi C. or Rachel G.
CONDITION TIME: 60 days - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence forthwith.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of successful completion of probation, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Count 2:
- Total sentence: 2 years (Initial Confinement: 1 year, Extended Supervision: 1 year) CONSECUTIVE to Count 1.   STAYED.
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 3 years Probation.
- Court costs waived
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Same as Count 1.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of successful completion of probation, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.
